LanguageData.DruFungus.label: Dried mushrooms
LanguageData.DruFungus.description: Dried mushrooms are a food product with a specific aroma and taste, obtained by drying fresh edible mushrooms. Dried mushrooms after pre-soaking can be widely used in cooking, for example in soups, stews, solyanka, sauces, pie fillings, and mushroom caviar.
LanguageData.DruFish.label: Dried salted fish
LanguageData.DruFish.description: The process consists of two stages: salting and drying. Salting is mandatory for a product without heat treatment: salt will destroy parasites if they are in the fish and slow down the decomposition processes.
LanguageData.DruFishPlastic.label: Dried salted fish in packaging
LanguageData.DruFishPlastic.description: The process consists of three stages: salting, drying and packaging. Salting is mandatory for a product without heat treatment: salt will destroy parasites if they are in the fish and slow down the decomposition processes. Once packaged in plastic, it can be stored almost forever.
LanguageData.MealFishAndBeer.label: Beer with dried fish
LanguageData.MealFishAndBeer.description: Beer and fish seem made for each other.
LanguageData.Yzvae.label: Uzvar
LanguageData.Yzvae.description: Uzvar-Compote based on dry fruits, dry berries or dried fruits.
LanguageData.Druchips.label: Dried chips
LanguageData.Druchips.description: Dried chips - a snack consisting of thin slices of potatoes.
LanguageData.DirtyEthanol.label: moonshine
LanguageData.DirtyEthanol.description: Dirty Ethanol is an organic compound with many side effects.
LanguageData.Ethanol.label: Ethanol
LanguageData.Ethanol.description: Ethanol is an organic compound belonging to the class of monohydric alcohols. Under standard conditions, ethanol is a volatile, flammable, colorless, transparent liquid with a characteristic odor and pungent taste. Active ingredient in alcoholic beverages.
